channel.title: Today we say goodbye to
channel.description:
The game development forum. After it's initial release there were some issues, and it didn't really get the attention it deserved. I'm sure all the community can agree when I say it's now nothing more than a spam bucket which has nobody to maintain, and no traffic to fill. While this is unfortunate news for the initial visionaries of the idea it doesn't mean game development will be shut out of the forum entirely.
A new board under general programming entitled "Game development" has been created where you can put content that may have gone on gamedev. If you have any suggestions, questions or issues with this please communicate through the appropriate channels like the suggestions board. Thanks.

item.title: Today we say goodbye to
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“Tom, post:22, topic:534520”]I’m not sure that a spoiler tag would fall under important and needed, but I can’t commit to things that we currently don’t have the ability to add. I hate to say this but we’re waiting for the forum to upgrade, and there is nothing I can do to make it go any quicker or to implement something like the spoiler tag before then. I’m fine with the idea and it’ll be worked on once we’ve upgraded.

The ability to change our forum boards is essential functionality whereas the addition of mods (such as a spoiler tag) requires compatible code, somebody to manually install it, and not to mention if we even tried before we’ve upgraded the forum the entire site might self-destruct.[/quote]
Fair enough. I am not going to specifically say that spoiler tags are the most important thing for the community, but the advertisement section would benefit immensely from it. Thank you for the response though :)!

Read full topic

item.title: Today we say goodbye to
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

I’m not sure that a spoiler tag would fall under important and needed, but I can’t commit to things that we currently don’t have the ability to add. I hate to say this but we’re waiting for the forum to upgrade, and there is nothing I can do to make it go any quicker or to implement something like the spoiler tag before then. I’m fine with the idea and it’ll be worked on once we’ve upgraded.

The ability to change our forum boards is essential functionality whereas the addition of mods (such as a spoiler tag) requires compatible code, somebody to manually install it, and not to mention if we even tried before we’ve upgraded the forum the entire site might self-destruct.

Read full topic

item.title: Today we say goodbye to
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

If the forum is going to receive some sort of change, is there a chance we will be seeing the additions of some important and needed additions that are not necessarily attached to sections? I know that [spoiler] tags were already in discussion before it was officially suggested in the correct section.

Read full topic

item.title: Today we say goodbye to
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

I would like to rework the board order at some stage, hopefully soon (I know it’s been a long standing prospect to do it properly) but for now I’m happy to just add to the current mess until a suitable rework is structured and implemented for board order. So while the game development board can be changed for now, this might change during the board order update. I’ve also left the gamedev forum open because I don’t want to get rid of the topics that are there, but I currently don’t have time to port them all though some staff are now helping out with that (Originally I was going to just set the boards to read only, but Mopar will set the forum into maintenance mode to appease the closing down thing at some point).

Read full topic

item.title: Today we say goodbye to
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Ambokile:

Game development board is doing very well so far!! Very popular!! Thankyou Tom!!

Because no one can see it

Davidi2:

To be fair, I don’t think web design/development deserves its own board (vs a sub board) either. Right now the forum index is really cluttered with all these useless boards that have been added because people wanted them or thought it would help ‘make us more active’, it’s just watered down the forum.

David’s right here, but of ALL the watered down sections, game development is the most relevant to the forum and private servers. Everyone here would like to make a game if they knew how

Read full topic

item.title: Today we say goodbye to
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

xx matty xx:

Tom you always make the worst decisions. I’m afraid I am no longer confident in your administration abilities, and will therefore be filing a formal complaint against you and will not be voting when we choose the next administrator. This board was my life - I don’t know how you can just go and take something like this away from such a dedicated community of games developers.

The board will get more attention here

edit: nevermind not as a sub board. Why is it a sub board? Game development is probably more popular than web design/development. Not mention who here wouldn’t like to learn how to make a game? Private servers are games. Web development is a bit more irrelevant.

Read full topic

item.title: Today we say goodbye to
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

The forum was a huge mistake.

Taharok and I started that forum only to be side swiped by real life, it was unexpected.

We apologize for how the forum ended up. While it may have worked after many years of attention, there just wasn’t enough community to feed from for it to work. Our expectations were a little high. We do hope the effort to make games remains and hopefully it will populate a board on the main forums much easier than it would an entire child site.

Read full topic
